Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: Brian M. Edwards
Reviews.Content: Update 8-21-2011I found the youtube feature on the video settings. It offers different video quality settings and some optimized ofr youtube. ALso, the burst feature is amazin, yesterday I tok a burst of 35 photos in the space of 5 seconds! Amazing.....First off, I own several "digital" cameras and have also previously had a few long zoom cameras.I don't like "big" cameras because I don't like lugging them around. So when I have owned long zoom cameras in the past, though I have liked them, tended to not use them much because I didn't like carrying them around, thus always ended up selling them.I have been keeping an eye out for a small point and shoot with a 20+ optical zoom and stumbled upon this one by chance on the Olympus web-site.I was impressed by what I saw, read a few reviews and ordered it off amazon.com (of course!) and received it the very next day. Right out of the box, the quality of the build stood out, it was also well laid out and I was delighted to find the battery was almost fully charged.I headed over to a nearby park and snapped off some photos and a few video clips.The quality of the photos and video were excellent, I used some of the "magic" settings which are special effects, I usually dismiss these types of effects as gimmicks but found some of them to be impressive.PlusesThe photos have really nice colors and look very life-like (which is what a camera should be capable of!)The zoom is quiet and smoothZoom works with HD and sound (the SP800UZ did not and went straight back!)You can take photos while shooting HD video (though not sure yet where it saves them)It can shoot HD video and say, 480 x 640  video (great for youtube etc or emailing)  at the same time which is very impressive.Super Panoramic mode, best I have seen yet.It has a lot of features, easy for beginnersTakes 3D photos (didn't realize it could until I got it...more icing on the cake lolMinusesNo Printed manual,you really need one for this camera, even though it is easy for beginners, some features are pretty advanced.All the promotional material keep saying YOUTUBE! yet so far I have not found any feature directly related to it (if you have please post a comment)This is a very well built camera, meant to last with some features that are very advanced. If you are looking for a long zoom, with HD video capability and good quality prints, this is for you, the icing on the cake is all the other amazing features you get! I have taken a few pic's in 3D but have not done anything with them. I will do an update when I have used the camera a bit more. Oh and I love the gunmetal gray color!For such a small camera, I am very impressed!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Solid Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a week now and so far I am very satisfied.  I got this camera because I don't like caring around my digital camera for photos and my HD Camcorder for video.  While this is in no way a complete replacement for my Digital SLR and my HD Camcorder, it does the job well quite well and is well worth having an all in one in my pocket.  I will still use my stand alone devices for those planned events when I want the very best.  For general day to day shots of family and fun times it is perfect and at a fair price.PROS:You can operate the zoom while shooting video.  Not all cameras do this.You can take full res snap shots while recording video. Again, the Multi-Recording is why I bought this.You can shoot multi sized photos or videos simultaneously.  This is great for a having a lower res copy ready for upload instantly.The zoom is 24x optical and it fits in my pocket.  The speed of the glass is very good considering the focal range of this unit.You can capture about 29 minutes continuos video at full 1080 (4GB limit on file size for SD cards)I was concerned about not having a view finder, but so far I can see the display well enough in daylight.CONSThe noise of the zoom and auto-focus motor is picked up when recording video, not very noticeable when there are other sounds being recorded, but very noticeable when there's relative silence.(my old canon camera produced a constant high pitch whine throughout all videos.  This is only when zooming and focus and less noticable.(Again, this is not a true replcement for a dedicated camcorder.)There seems to be a 2 snapshot limit of still pics while recording video.  I'm not certain if that is a setting I can change or what the deal is.  Even if it is just 2, that's workable for me.  I would typically be taking stills and then decide to have video as well, which this camera makes effortless to do.  There's a dedicated record button and off you go.Some pics will have "soft" details when viewed close up at full res.  This is fairly common though on most point and shoots. (Again, not a true replacement of high DSLR)  However, most shots can have nice sharp detail when you take some time to properly compose the shot.Maybe this is just me, but I always think that if something feels heavy it's built better.  This feels too light in that regard, but like I said, maybe that's just me.  :)I highly reccomend this for the reasons and purpose that I have stated using it for.  All cameras have some drawbacks, but none of those I listed prohibit me from reccomending it.  They are relatively minor considering.

Reviews.Title: I'm a happy boy!
Reviews.Author: Charles Kirchhoff "skikir"
Reviews.Content: This going to be a quick and dirty review.  I got this camera just over a week ago to replace my Canon A720IS.  My Canon is a great camera and gives great shots and is solid as a rock.  All the paint is warn off all the edges from accompanying me on hunting, camping, traveling and daily use. But I had a family todo and wanted a long zoom and HD video.  I spent a lot of time checking out cameras from Sony, Nikon, Panasonic, Canon and others and none had everything I wanted.  Then at the last minute I found the SZ-30mr.  It was so new I could not find any hands on reviews but it had everything I was looking for and took a leap of faith, bared my credit card and bought it.  I was not disappointed.  I was so busy before traveling for a wedding/reunion for which I bought this camera for, I did not get a chance to learn it.  However, it was not that difficult. And I was able master it enough to get the job done.  I bought a 16 gig SD card, a spare battery and external charger.  I like the external charger since it does not take the camera out of action during charging. Plus the cable is propitiatory and makes it one more thing to carry and get lost and does not work with anything else.  I spent a week traveling for a wedding/family reunion and took tons of pictures and videos. Every morning I would change the battery. I was able to video 90 percent of the time of a wedding ceremony at full 1080i and take full resolution 16 megapixel stills at the same time as well as taking many videos and stills at the reception before the battery gave out and of course like an idiot I left the spare battery in the charger!  But by that that time toasts had been made, cakes were cut and dances were made and anything I did miss was not important.  I'm a picture taking fool so for most anyone else I think battery life is fine.  In just over a week of heavy use I took just over 5 GIG of video and images.  I have not had time to analyze in any quantitative way to the quality of the images since I've been back BUT by just reviewing them on my net book on the road and on a 47" HD TV at the resort, using an external HDMI cable from the camera, the pictures look great and the HD videos are impressive.  OH, Oh, the panorama mode is absolutely fantastic!  Just sweep across the scene and your done.  And panorama play back from the camera is great.  Which brings up playback using the camera.  By hooking up a "D" type HDMI cable ($29 from Radio Shack) you can play back pictures and videos to a HD TV.  At home I discovered my Panasonic TV remote would control the playback, at the resort I could not get the remote to work so I had to use the camera controls manually but better than nothing and it was fun reviewing the event with the family while there.  It was nice not to have to carry my big laptop and cables and setups to play back images.  Another fun thing we did is we had the family movies from the 40s and 50s placed on DVD and while there at the reunion we watched it.  While my older brother and sister narrated and made comments of where and who were in the silent movie I videoed the video and recorded their comments.  I plan on taking the sound track from my video and add it to the silent movies on the DVD.  This way I we can preserve so much that would have been lost.  I would never have know that little old lady in the movie was my Great Great grand mother if my brother and sister had not pointed her out!  I was able to record over an hour and fifteen minutes of continuous recording.  It was at a lower resolution but all I waned was the audio and the some video to make sure I get it synced properly.  The camera is pretty responsive.  Some comment on the wait time between pictures but remember people, your dealing with 16 megapixels!  You really need a class 10 SD card to speed up the storage time.  Cut that back to 8MP and cycle time is much faster.  The wide angle is perfect for the indoor group shots.  Let's be frank, no one in their right mind has the right to take 600mm telephoto shots hand held.  However on a sunny day with the ISO kicked up I was able to get some impressive results just seeing what I could do with it.  I believe many people don't know how to take pictures and just mash down the button like a cheap Instamatic without pausing in the intermediate position long enough to allow the camera time to focus giving blurry images.  If the exposure button is used properly this camera gives excellent results.  The only beefs I have with this camera are minor.  The biggest problem is the Mode dial moves too easily.  Every time I pulled it out of my pocket I had to check the mode because it get changed so easily.  It needs to be either harder to turn or have some kind of locking device.  Also, the markings are hard to read if you are far sighted with out reading glasses.  It would be nice to have it labled in multi colors so you don't have to put on your glasses to know where your at.  Another comment is the bezel ring around the closed lens has a edge on it that is sharp and does not feel good and drags on the fabric of the pocket when pulling out.  I may take some sandpaper and smooth that out.  The last issue I have is the finish on the camera.  I like to take candid pictures with out having people freezing up and not acting normal or those with camera phobia covering their faces or turning away when a camera is brought out.  The finish on this camera is very shinny and chrome like.  This thing sparkles and shines like a lit up disco ball in your hands!  I was amazed how distracting it was for me when I was in front of it especially in sun light.  I may do some buffing on it.  In closing, I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera -- A lot to learn
Reviews.Author: D. Shackleford
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of great features and some of the pictures I've taken are really good.  I think the challenge with this kind of camera is learning which shooting mode works best to get the best picture in a certain situation.  Some reviewers complained for example that it is slow -- but in action mode, the response is practically instant.  Some reviewers complained that the pictures aren't sharp -- but I find it takes very sharp pictures if the focus is good.  It's easy to be out of focus or blurry with a megazoom like this -- but isn't that true of any zoom at 24X?So far my thoughts on each feature are:1.  picture quality -- great2.  wide-angle -- great3.  Zoom -- great4.  LCD screen -- great6.  speed -- great (in action mode, or burst mode)7.  button layout -- good8.  video -- haven't tried yet -- but its 1080 HD so ...9.  panorama -- good10. flash -- great11. MR mode -- why?12. 3D mode -- really need that?13. Magic mode -- why?14. Battery life -- great.15. Super-macro mode -- great.16. In low light -- good17. Ease of use -- great for simple pictures, for anything challenging, its okay with manual18. Size and Weight -- great19. Menus -- okay19. Software -- poor -- I probably won't use that.Negatives ...1.  Non-standard USB cable connector.2.  Can't shoot and charge at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-30MR Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Recycler "moose"
Reviews.Content: This camera is EXACTLY what we were looking for! The zoom is awesome - all options are very easy to use. The video comes out great & having the hand grip makes it feel very secure, but can still fit in your pocket. No complaints thus far -- HOWEVER when ordering - remember to order a memory card! NOWHERE on the Amazon site does it tell you what is included with the camera & an Amazon customer service rep could not tell us either! But we are completely satisfied with this product. Great for ameteurs on the go!

Reviews.Title: Great Features in a Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: bbmertz
Reviews.Content: Overall great camera with unbelievable long range zoom and indoor image quality even in low light, in a form factor which was much smaller than I expected. Extra features are really nice including 3D photos (which looked good on my Panasonic plasma 3D TV) and panorama photos, as well as continuous shooting mode which takes so many photos in rapid succession that they look like a video. One fun feature is pet detection mode which automatically snaps a picture whenever it senses a cat or dog face. (Didn't test multi-record mode yet.)  Menus are fairly easy to navigate.Although I am very satisfied, there were a few areas which leave room for improvement. Shutter lag as well as processing time after each picture was a bit longer than I expected, with the camera freezing for a second or two when "busy" preparing for the next shot (using a class 6 SDHC card). Photo quality was generally very good, but was a bit blurry when capturing moving objects or some extreme telephoto shots if not holding the camera still. Video was good but the microphone picked up some wind sounds in a light breeze.FYI, the Sony LCS-CSJ case is a perfect fit for this camera (it's hard to find compact cases for this one.)

Reviews.Title: Olympus ZR-30 Camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne R. Courtemanche
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, so many capabilities. For example, you can do clips while taking still pics, panaramic shots, hd video, and much more. There is a learning curve for the novice. It would be easier for Olympus to include a user manual instead of having it on the cd.Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Jackie in Florida
Reviews.Content: I've been an Olympus camera owner for years, but this is the best yet.  The most impressive feature is the hand-held night time feature.  I took dusk and nighttime pictures of cities from an airplane and they were excellent.  I was also amazed by the cat face and dog face features.  I set it to cat face and it took a picture every time the cat looked toward the camera.  Then I set it to dog face and it took the dog's picture but didn't take a picture when the cat looked toward the camera.  I'm still learning about this camera but I have nothing but good to say about it.

Reviews.Title: Returned for color problems
Reviews.Author: Judi Dalton "judi d"
Reviews.Content: Id be happy for some feedback if this might have been a defective camera. I emailed Olympus and got no response. The colors were not as vivid as in real life.  A gorgeous Magenta flower, for instance, turned out pink. A lovely pink but no matter what the setting, it was not purple.  Also on the iAuto mode, every picture taken showed the cloudy sky icon, no matter whether the sky was cloudy or cloudless.I liked the zoom, clear pictures, nicely built but was so disappointed in the color production that it wasn't worth keeping.Let me know if I've missed something I should have known to do

Reviews.Title: I'm now a believer in digital zoom...
Reviews.Author: D Leigh
Reviews.Content: ...thanks to this camera. I carry it absolutely everywhere with me. It takes spectacular pictures and is the first point-and-shoot style camera I've found with a digital zoom I actually trust. I use it for everything from taking pictures of products for my company to list online to snapshots at my best friend's wedding over this past weekend. All in all I love it. I need to actually sit down and go through the manual and get all of the settings down but ended up accidentally setting it to one of the "magic" settings while shooting a gorgeous double rainbow over a meadow and got sparkles on all of the light-catching areas--windows of a nearby barn, etc.--which actually ended up being pretty cute, and I'm looking forward to exploring them more.On the digital zoom...my previous experience with digital zooms has taught me never, ever to trust them so when my friend Nathan, who carries his SZ-30 everywhere too and recommended it to me in the first place, showed me how well it worked on this lovely, compact little Olympus my jaw might actually have dropped. My photobucket site's album of the full moon over Fort Collins, CO from Horsetooth Reservoir has been downloaded multiple times by strangers which to me is always a good sign...many of the photos were taken using the digital zoom and the moon appears to be floating and embraced by the surrounding clouds. As if I'm the only amateur pseudo-photographer to ever take pictures of the full moon...still, it was heartening to see that other site members were enjoying my photos. A quick scan-through of the photos from the wedding has me grinning: I am already greatly looking forward to posting them to facebook as well as photobucket. I even got a few rather ethereal arm's-length self-portraits with this camera. I am so grateful I bought this --in particular-- camera. I haven't yet figured out how to quickly shoot multiple pics but again, need to sit down and actually go through the settings; I was so excited to get the camera I loaded it and charged it and began using it immediately. I highly recommend buying a 2nd battery and at last an 8GB SD card --it doesn't come with any memory, so get at least an 8GB so you can hang onto everything and keep on snapping. LOVE this camera. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Wondeful camera
Reviews.Author: F. VILELA
Reviews.Content: After researching for a couple of months I finally chose the Olympus SZ30 over the Sony HX9, Casio ZR100, Samsung WB750 and Fuji F600. I've had the camera for a month and I'm pretty impressed with the overall performance. It's definitely the most beautiful camera I've ever had amongst about a dozen models from Ricoh (Caplio R4, R5 and R6), Canon (SD200, SD650), Panasonic (FZ8, FZ28, FZ45), Sony (HX5). Build quality is very good. The menus are pretty intuitive. Handling is a breeze. The speed is good. Picture quality is very good most times as far as small sensors are concerned. Video is smooth. The filters are fun to use. Flash is excellent, open it when needed. Super macro is fantastic. Tele reach is impressive. Low light pics without flash are better than expected. For $284 this was the best camera for me in its category.Ratings:Design - 5Features - 4Ease of use - 4.5Image quality - 4Price - 4Problems: Pre-focus stabiliser is quite noisy but it doesn't bother me at all. Focus not easy in low contrast situations when in macro or tele, you need some patience to get it. Panorama doesn't work well on rare occasions with minor stitching artifacts. Focus hunting occasionally when videoing. Ridiculous battery life - get one or two spare ones. No manual controls. No dedicated burst or iso button.

Reviews.Title: Unpleasant Experiance
Reviews.Author: Arnold Leder
Reviews.Content: Zero Stars:  This camera is really fancy, but it has spent more time at the warranty repair facility than I've had it.  It came back from the repair facility the first time with 2 new problems.  I don't think I'll try another Olympus product, should have bought a Cannon product.

Reviews.Title: Has potential
Reviews.Author: Fan of Fiction
Reviews.Content: If you can get a picture in focus it takes amazing pictures, but that is a big IF.  Going through the pictures that I took there is an abundance of them that were blurrier than I had originally thought.  If I had to give a percentage I would say close to 80% were blurry.  I had bought the camera to take pictures of my new puppy but as all puppies do she moves around a lot and the pictures just come out blurry.  Trying sport mode and multiple pictures don't seem to help the problem.  Higher resolution does not help when the pictures are not clear.On a side note all the playing I did with 3D didn't get any pic look like it was in 3D.I would rather use my old Kodak 5 MP with 10 x optical zoom (it's at least ten years old) and I will probably just give the camera to my 10 year old nephew because he will not know the difference.

Reviews.Title: Handy and feature packed camera
Reviews.Author: jce3
Reviews.Content: I have been an amateur photographer nearly all of my life. At present I own 3 digital cameras, each of which has it's uses. A Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-WX9, Olympus SZ30 , and a Canon PowerShot SX40 HR.The Sony is my super small pocket camera and the Canon is my mega zoom bridge camera.The Olympus SZ30 is my mid range camera when I want a something portable but still with a long zoom lens.This camera has so many adjustments that it boggles the mind. Read the manual online or print it off. I seldom use automatic settings on any camera as they tend to be set for ideal situations. But with a few tweaks on program mode this camera takes outstanding pictures inside and out! The flash is nice and has a long coverage range. The CMOS provides very good indoor image quality even without a flash. Again, setting make all the difference.If you are strictly a pull it out of the pocket and take pictures type person, this might not be the camera for you. Not that the pictures on auto aren't good, they are. But if you want exceptional pictures then minor adjustments make all the difference on any camera that alows them.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: bassemkaram
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera if you experiment at first. P Auto does give better pictures indoors if you know how to set it right. iAuto does well out doors.  Do your homework to learn how to use the camera well to produce great pictures . This camera for above average users that enjoy photography without paying the big $, Otherwise, buy a simple camera and save your money

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera with more features than I know what to do with
Reviews.Author: Ari
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago and I am continuing to find new features to use on this great piece of technology.  It takes great pictures, but I seem to have to charge it often.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Amr Elhakim
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for a little over a week now and I just love it. I have been looking for a small camera with a big zoom and this is the best one so far.

Reviews.Title: Reconditioned no deal!  Purchased from highly regarded The Bargain Deal Store
Reviews.Author: #1 Nana
Reviews.Content: I received this camera from above mentioned "other seller" shipped & guaranteed by Amazon, but Stabilization did not work!  Beautiful looking camera, lightweight, small, but 16 MP pictures about the same as my 8 MP iPhone 5!  The Zoom function to 24x, even worse!  I would have liked to have had it replaced, but returns only allows refund, so maybe as a "new" camera I will have better luck!  "Busy" stays on constantly , no matter how steady I hold camera.  No sharpness on Optical Zoom!  Wanter a camera with rechargeable Lithum ion battery and there are very few that are not AA.  I do a lot of purchasing from Amazon, but this was my most disappointing!Because I could not get replacement had to return the Halcyon 1500 Lithium Iron additional batteries & charger also.  Can't advise how they respond to charge for time needed or function because I don't have camera.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished camera with no flash!
Reviews.Author: annie-ofs
Reviews.Content: Great zoom!Great pictures!Great price from Bling!Then I took it on my trip to Italy.(I should have used a little tripod when I zoomed in on the artwork in Cathedrals.)Whenever I put the flash up to take pictures of friends in low light setting, it wouldn't take a picture.Now it's too late to return.I AM VERY DISAPPOINTED IN BLING FOR SELLING ME A NON-REFURBISHED CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Perfect - Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Jimenez "RJ"
Reviews.Content: just what mom wanted - This Camera does a lot - you cant go wrong with it.. enough said !enough said !enough said !

Reviews.Title: Great, long-zoom, point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: James Klaproth
Reviews.Content: When looking for a new camera, as I did recently, I begin by going to steve's digicams website (http://www.steves-digicams.com/)and selecting "The Best Cameras". That brings up a list of categories like DSLRs , compact point and shoots, etc. I was looking for a long optical zoom camera and this one was listed as one of the best. I read the reviews of it and viewed the photos it took and decided it was an option for me.I love Amazon as they list all the buying options so I looked for a refurbished copy and selected one done by Olympus that was well priced. I took the plunge and the camera arrived on schedule and perfect condition.I took some time reading the manual that comes on a CD disk and discovered the great features it had. I have only had it a short time and I took many photos outdoors and indoors. The built-in popup flash is very powerful, and sometime too much so as it tends to overexpose the scene. I think a work around may be to place a white handkerchief or a tissue over the flash to cut down the light output.The long zoom is amazing as it zooms out to 24x which is equivalent to a 600mm zoom lens on a 35mm camera! You can extend the zoom range by using the digital zoom, which I turn off in the menu. A tripod or monopod is definitely recommended at this extreme range.I did not give the camera 5 stars as I thought some of the outdoor images were a tad bit washed out. I believe it is due to the lens quality in this camera. My former Panasonic camera had a Leica lens which was much sharper, but the images in the Olympus do look better when you view them on a computer screen and you can generally correct them with software. All in all, I am happy with my purchase and I would recommend that you consider this camera.

Reviews.Title: A very nice, user friendly, camera.
Reviews.Author: Bonnie L. Shaffer
Reviews.Content: A very nice, user friendly, camera.Love the zooming capacity.  Light weight and I like the chrome/graphite finish of the housing.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Lisa V. Gray
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice; takes great pictures and is fairly simple to use.  I love the dog/cat picture option, the panoramic mode, and the low light feature.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone.  I purchased an extra battery so that I always had one fully charged, but so far I haven't needed it.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: Maltonomy
Reviews.Content: Havent had any trouble with it yet, I only dislike the proprietary USB connector, I want a great camera like this that I can use with any of those numerous usb cables I have for everything else.

Reviews.Title: no really satisfied
Reviews.Author: gdo145
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera (new)I don't usually use it. It's never fellbut for a new camera it starts toturned off it self while i take picturesor after I have taken the picture butthe pic was not saved, I should removethe battery or memory card (I didn't knowwhich ones of those was causin the problemso I removed both). Not many to talk aboutbut I'm not satisfied at all, cuz I hve been usingthis camera (bought in another country)before to buy it in amazon

Reviews.Title: olympus sz30
Reviews.Author: alberto struve
Reviews.Content: muy buena camara facil de manejar, buen tamaño, buen zoom, la bateria es bastente rendidora, solo que a veces el color y la nitidez no es tan perfecto

Reviews.Title: Cr@p - POS  -- Paid more than the price listed, gift for wife -- BLURRY ALL THE TIME - my 10 yr old son inherited
Reviews.Author: MARS from LA
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a gift for my wife who wanted a lighter camera than a Cannon, previously purchased (which works great).  I bought her this POS and it takes BLURRY pictures all the time regardless of settings.  I wish I could give a negative rating.  We gave it to my 10 yr old son as a camera for trips and he is complaining about this garbage as well.  I'm just going to donate it to charity and take the write-off.  I will not be buying Olympus any time soon and will be the first to speak up against the shotty products.  Bought it over a year ago and have given it more than a fare share of time to work properly.  If you do buy it don't be satisfied that it works on occasion - IT WILL FAIL you when you need it most.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen W. Hayes
Reviews.Content: everything i wanted it to be. great color, comapact, functions work well. Not a expert camera bug but i like it

Reviews.Title: A good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: David C. Howard
Reviews.Content: A compact and fairly easy to use camera. A prime reason for my purchase was the wide zoom range. I am disappointed that the image stabilization is not as good as I expected.  Perhaps I was expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: CrazyBird "I am a retired Histology Technicia...
Reviews.Content: I sought out an Olympus camera because of past experience with their Stylus 710 series camera.  I am afraid this model Olympus has been a real disappointment though.This has all of the options necessary to make fine photographs yet it does not take sharp pictures and often they are simpley out of focus.  The stabilization option does not work well and I find the auto focus is slow.  If there is any movement by or the subject or myself the picture is ruined.  The dail for setting options is impossible to read unless in very good light as there is very little contrast in the dial color and the font color.  I would not reccomend this camera.

Reviews.Title: best buy
Reviews.Author: ravvi
Reviews.Content: Amazing zoom and very fine picture quality.Even the camera build and finish is awesome.cons : It takes 3-4 hrs to charge the battery.  The image  gets quite shaky on full zoom.A class 10  SD card is preferred. It reduces the time takenwhile saving the image after the snapping.A regular class 4 SD card takes an awkward lot of time for saving an image.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy for Once
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I have bought numerous compact digital cameras and have never been happy with them... until now. I love this camera. It takes great pictures, even indoors, and very good video. I have a Flip and a Vado and will probably sell both of them. This camera takes much better video. I am a Nikon man to the core, but this Olympus has made me look their way a bit more. Very happy and I would buy this camera again. The only negative thing I have found is the control are a bit touchy and overly sensitive, but for the quality of camera at this price I can deal with it. This is the first compact digital camera I have ever been this satisfied with.

Reviews.Title: Megapixel lies revealed
Reviews.Author: Batman
Reviews.Content: #1 Image quality is same as 10MP camera (same standard sensor size), but larger and file size is 5MB+.#2 Camera is best at taking pictures of small items rather then large (if you want to achieve blurry background)#3 Shutter speed is automatic and does not always shoot fast or slow enough for you to take great pictures.#4 Battery does not stay locked. Once you shake the camera and open battery lid, it falls off because it gets unlocked.#5 Zoom control is slippery and not comfortable to use at all. Zoom speed is not variable, its constant even for video recording.#6 Panorama image maker has great quality loss. Images being made while panning camera instead of stitching shots after you take them. none smart phones can do better then that. Panorama available in full 180 rotation or standard 90.#7 3D images are not what you think. You cannot watch them with red/cyan 3d glasses or any glasses for that matter. You have to have 3D TV to do it, otherwise 3d shots are GARBAGE for most.#8 Screen shuts off and lens moves back in for no reason at all. It will then turn on and zoom back in where it was, but it gets annoying.#9 1080p Video is awesome. Wish it had 60fps or any video recording effects such as movie effect and other scene presets. It does have pencil and some other garbage presets, but they are just useless but FUN.#10 you dont get battery charger into which you could place your battery, you get a wall jack that connects to your camera to charge it, and cord is like 10" short.#11 no HDMI cable included. Buy separate.#12 only 1 battery included and it is very likely to be near the end of its life (2-3 years after manufacture date)

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: Barry Ries
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. lightweight, powerful. love the ability to take pictures while shooting video! Just took it to Central Americaand it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Chubb "Chubb"
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with the camera's results.  I've never owned an Olympus camera before, but am very glad I bought this one.  It is easy to use, and very, very small, easy to put in your pocket; but I must admit I am not a photography expert.  If you are a professional, you probably won't be happy.  You should spend $1500 to buy yourself a "good" camera.  If you are an amateur, you will be very impressed.  The pictures are excellent.  Sixteen MG takes a supurb quality picture, and you will love the 24 optical zoom.I haven't used the movie portion because I don't know how to upload and make a DVD on my computer, but the bottom line is I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!![For those who are interested---I purchased this through Amazon and the seller was J&R; Camera out of New York.  I have purchased many electronic items from them in the past 20 years and have ALWAYS found them to be an above average company to deal with.  Usually if a company says their home address is New York I am very hesitant to deal with them.  I have had dealings with some that were as dishonest as they come.]

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Cam
Reviews.Author: MarwanSharara
Reviews.Content: I think it is the best cam you could ever get for this price. Many features that will help you to get a very clear shoots with minimum setups. The 24X zoom is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ30
Reviews.Author: LinkPaff
Reviews.Content: VERY PLEASED.  Have had the camera 2 months, incl. trip to Hawaii and one to Taos, NM.  Used video zoom and still shots in hot weather, super cold weather, skiing downhill, on the ocean.  Pictures are very clear and the video is stable on replay.  Love the video zoom, although when you zoom in and then back out, it has no way of knowing where to call the focal point.  Probably operator error, but it is an easy to use camera.  YOU HAVE TO READ THE OPERATORS MANUAL, otherwise, you'll do the "guys way" and think you can intuitively figure it all out.  Good luck, LOL.  Nonetheless, I love the camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, needs tripod
Reviews.Author: Jason Lee Perkins
Reviews.Content: Update- after further playing with this camera. I have since gave the camera away and it is not even worth one star.  Olympus was not helpful with fixing the problems.Nice sleek, pretty attractive camera. I received this camera yesterday, and as someone who loves to take pictures I couldn't wait to play with it.  I love the different "magic" modes.  Fish Eye is definitely fun.  Its shutter speed on high surprised me.  I also own a Nikon D300 and a Canon 50D and the shutter on high on the SZ 30 MR out does both of those combined hands down.  Very fast.  You can make a photo movie and not miss a frame.  I haven't played with the MR side yet.  I also like that the battery doesn't have to come out of the camera to charge.  plug the camera in- it charges the battery.  Same with getting your photos off- plug the camera in by USB to the computer and get your pictures.  Much easier then having to have a card reader- that are typically slow, and often bulky with long cords and get lost.BUT- the book on how to use this camera comes on a DISK- useless in the field and if your anything like me, you don't like to shoot and learn at home in front of a computer.  I would much rather be able to take a small book with me and learn as I go in the field. I do a lot of birding and enjoy photographing them.  I also visit our local aquarium often and photograph the whales and penguins on a regular basis.You need a tripod when at the 600mm optical zoom.  I have not been able to get a clear shot at 600mm, but when I hold my much heavier Canon 50D with a 400mm zoom I am able to get crystal clear shots. I rarely if ever use a tripod for my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Agustina
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect combination, excellent photos with a small camera. Very comfortable to take it anywhere. I love it

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: McB "KM"
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert on cameras, but I have used a few.  I was looking for an above average camera with high optical zoom capability and a great quality picture....at a bargain price.  This camera meets that criteria and much more.  It'll probably take me over a year to figure out how to best utilize the other neat features (that weren't as important to me), and I actually look forward to unfolding those features, one at a time.  Sorry for not using camera jargon, but I don't really know much :-).  This camera is perfect for ME.

Reviews.Title: My 7 year old olympus is better
Reviews.Author: Catbird
Reviews.Content: I have a 7 year old Olympus 10 zoom point and shoot but it's difficult to find new batteries for it, so I thought I'd get a newer camera. I got this new one with the 24x zoom and much higher megpixels (my old one has only 4 mp). But...when you take pictures outside with this new camera they are really over exposed, so you have to move the numbers down to -2 or so to get real color. But skin color is the worst -- people's skin looks like putty. I understand that when using an old 4 mp camera, but a 16? And there's a weird distortion on some shots -- like windows are slanted when you take a photo of the side of a house. Sure you have a cool video camera and such, but the basics are off. I don't get why some photos at a certain distance away are clear, but other photos are fuzzy. Inside shots seem pretty good, but probably because the camera likes to overexpose so interior shots are very bright. Oh well, it's back to my old Olympus that has been around the world with me -- maybe when I have more time I'll try again to find a new camera.

Reviews.Title: 1 year of ownership - very poor camera
Reviews.Author: Arnie
Reviews.Content: I have owned many Olympus products and am surprised at the poor quality of this particular camera. I will list what I am dissatisfied with after one year of use.1. Poor picture quality, probably the worst I have owned (it can only focus in the strongest light settings or if flash is used.  Picture quality unacceptable for 16 megapixel, very grainy if you zoom in on the pictures.2. Camera is light and cheap feeling.3. Zoom is jerky and makes noise that is very evident in video.4. Video has problems focusing unless not zoomed at all.5. Video is jerky off and on even if on tripod and very jerky if you pan.6. This camera eats batteries.I will never order a camera sight unseen from online.  Try it out first!

Reviews.Title: Maravilloso Trabajar Con Uds
Reviews.Author: Richard Moya "Gichad"
Reviews.Content: Me siento satisfecho haber hecho negocio con uds, Muy buen trabajo, excelente tiempo de entrega, pieza nueva como lo ofrecen en la pagina no dudo en recomendarlo, y me gustaria trabajar otra vez con uds.

Reviews.Title: Think twice be for buying!
Reviews.Author: T. L. Cole
Reviews.Content: Very disapointed, this camera is all but useless for any pictures inside, will not focus and pictures are washed out. But on the other hand outside pictures or crisp and clear. What a wast of $300.00 I wiil stay with my lumix camera's from now on.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE camera
Reviews.Author: levismom1292
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for two weeks and I am about to return it. 9 of 10 inside pictures taken are blurry! I went to a college graduation the other day and as loon as the pictures were taken on zoom and you held the camera extremely STILL it was a great picture otherwise I got no good pictures and I am very unhappy with this camera. I have had an Olympus camera before and it was a great camera. I really don't understand this one?!

Reviews.Title: Disapointing sharpness
Reviews.Author: Berg
Reviews.Content: I have not been able to take Cristal clear pictures. In the display  the image looks 100% sharp and clear but after shooting , the picture recorded is not sharp, have tryed in  all modes, magic modes, auto, etc.. and still not able to get "nikon" like images. I  tought this camera was going to be the latest and greatest  but I  prefer to shoot my old 5MPixel  6 years old Canon.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Juliano
Reviews.Content: Excelente máquina! Superou minhas expectativas. Somente a bateria poderia durar dois dias de muitas fotos tiradas. A Amazon também foi muito eficiente na entrega.

Reviews.Title: Excelente compra!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Kopper Barquero
Reviews.Content: Estoy muy contento con la compra de esta cámara Olympus, no solo por ella, sino  también por el proceso de envío de este artículo! Rápido y muy eficiente. Muchas gracias amazon.com

Reviews.Title: EXCELENTE CAMARA
Reviews.Author: carlos
Reviews.Content: MUY BUEN PRODUCTO ENTREGA A TIEMPO VINO CON TODO LO DESCRITO EN EL ARTICULO MEJOR IMPOSIBLE SIN RAYADURAS TOTALMENTE NUEVO Y EN PERFECTA CONDICIONES LOS RECOMIENDO AMPLIAMENTE SIN DUDAS CARLOS SANCHEZ DESDE GUARENAS VENEZUELA.

Reviews.Title: Problem right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Dan Pantzer
Reviews.Content: I've really been looking forward to this Olympus model, after dropping my Lumix DMC-ZS7 in a Costa Rica waterfall. The camera just arrived from Amazon today, and will be going right back. There is a small piece of lint or something on the internal lens that will not go away and simply gets blurry or more clear depending on the zoom ... shows up on the pics. Very disappointing, and hope this is a rare problem and not a general indication of build quality. sad.Obviously this could end up being a 5-star review (or less) depending on how the replacement fares.  Will plan to update later.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ30 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: slmb52
Reviews.Content: My sister & I couldn't wait until we were able to get this camera.  They came & after opening one of them and trying to get what I thought was the plastic covering off, I decided to send mine back.  The camera was plastic, looked like a childs camera. I knew I would drop it once and it would be destroyed.  My sister decided to send hers back also for the same reason. I was very disappointed, I liked everything the camera said it could do.  Amazon did make it very easy to return the cameras and for that I am thankful.

Reviews.Title: doesn't give you the photo you expect :(
Reviews.Author: Bayan
Reviews.Content: When I bought this Camera I thought that it would give a photo with very high quality. However, I was shocked when I saw the photo that I took. It is very slow and the picture that usually give  you might be shaky probably all the time. if you wanna buy a camera , I don't recommend this one. :(

1080P HD Movie and HDMI Controlq

7FPS High-Speed Continuous Shooting (16 MP)
Multi-Recording Function
Tue Pic III 24X Zoom
Wide Angle HD
SZ-30MR Digital Camera
USB Cable & Charger F-2AC , Audio/Video Cable
Lithium-Ion Battery LI-50B, Quick Start Guide
Instruction Manual & Software CD, Neck Strap, Warranty Card
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus SZ30 16 MP Digital Camera, Wide-Angle 24x Optical Zoom with Multi-Recording Capability and 3" LCD (Silver)
